review: I love it. Except for the fact that every time I go to use it, my batteries in the remote are dead. I don't use it every day. I use it about once a week. I have replaced the batteries twice in the remote, and I have only used it three times in a month. I guess it is a good way for Amazon to force you to buy rechargeable batteries from them.
author: Chase Frazier

review: The video streaming is really fast and the quality is great. However, it has made me download Netflix more than once which was frustrating when I just wanted to turn it on and watch something. I was given the Amazon fire as a gift so I had little prior knowledge of what it was about. I still don't really understand all of the features. It's nice to watch Netflix on, but you can watch Netflix on a lot of other devices as well. The voice command feature is nice and it seems like there is a wide selection of movies, however all of the movies cost about the same as they would if I used my time warner on demand. Maybe the fire offers a lot better selection if you have Amazon prime. It just seems like the fire's interface isn't very friendly and has a cold business setup. I'm in my late 20's and I usually embrace technology, but I just don't see why I would use this and pay the same for movies if not more than I would thru my cable on demand services or red box.
